description_txt: stated on October 26, 2010 in speeches at schools across the state:
quote_txt: Georgia's high school graduation rate topped 80 percent in 2010.

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2010 in a debate.:
quote_txt: Says over 25 percent of the Texas budget funds services to non-U.S. citizens.

description_txt: stated on October 31, 2010 in a message via the Internet:
quote_txt: "Pres. Obama's finance team is recommending a . . . 1% tax on all transactions at any financial institution."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • November 12, 2010

description_txt: stated on November 7, 2010 in an interview on ABC's This Week with Christiane Amanpour:
quote_txt: "The average federal employee makes $120,000 a year. The average private employee makes $60,000 a year."

description_txt: stated on September 19, 2010 in a TV interview.:
quote_txt: Republican plan to extend Bush tax cuts "would double deficit projections going forward for the next couple of decades."

description_txt: stated on November 8, 2010 in a news release:
quote_txt: Says that the federal gas tax has not been raised since 1993.

description_txt: stated on November 10, 2010 in a campaign video and numerous other campaign statements:
quote_txt: As mayor, Barrett led efforts to redevelop the Menomonee Valley, "which now supports nearly 4,000 jobs in Wisconsin."

description_txt: stated on October 13, 2010 in a campaign television ad:
quote_txt: Says he's arrested more criminals, "including thousands of child predators and sex offenders," than any previous Texas attorney general.

description_txt: stated on November 10, 2010 in a mailer:
quote_txt: Half of children struck by cars near schools are hit by parents driving children to school.

description_txt: stated on November 9, 2010 in an interview with Fox News.:
quote_txt: "We're the only system of federalism in the world."

description_txt: stated on November 7, 2010 in a prepared speech:
quote_txt: Grocery prices "have risen significantly over the past year or so."

description_txt: stated on October 25, 2010 in testimony given at a public hearing:
quote_txt: Electric utility FirstEnergy's annual revenues are greater "than the GDP of Haiti, Kyrgyzstan, Iceland, or 15 African nations."

description_txt: stated on November 7, 2010 in a "60 Minutes" interview:
quote_txt: "One of the interesting things about the Recovery Act was most of the projects came in under budget, faster than expected, because there's just not a lot of work there."

description_txt: stated on September 29, 2010 in a news release:
quote_txt: In 2011, Milwaukee Public Schools "will provide 77 cents in employee benefits for every dollar it spends on wages."

description_txt: stated on November 8, 2010 in an interview on The Daily Show:
quote_txt: "I had five of my citizens that were killed last week" because of border security problems.

description_txt: stated on November 3, 2010 in a statement:
quote_txt: It’s hard to get people in Portland to vote yes on ballot measures, especially when there’s opposition.

description_txt: stated on October 29, 2010 in press release:
quote_txt: "Animal abuse is often an indicative trait of future acts of violence against humans."

description_txt: stated on November 7, 2010 in an interview on "This Week with Christiane Amanpour.":
quote_txt: "Anybody who is familiar with the historical data from the IRS knows that raising income tax rates will likely actually reduce federal revenues."

description_txt: stated on November 8, 2010 in an Orlando rail conference.:
quote_txt: "The amount of the revenue required by the state (for the construction of high-speed rail) is around 10 percent."

description_txt: stated on November 3, 2010 in a news conference:
quote_txt: Says that the new financial services law requires 358 regulatory filings.

description_txt: stated on November 5, 2010 in a newspaper Op/Ed:
quote_txt: The debt is "nearly $6 trillion more than when President Obama was sworn into office."

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2010 in an interview on toll roads as an option for state highways:
quote_txt: On toll roads.

description_txt: stated on October 18, 2010 in an interview:
quote_txt: Georgia and other states with weak gun laws have more crime.

description_txt: stated on November 7, 2010 in an interview on ABC's "This Week with Christiane Amanpour":
quote_txt: "The interest on the debt now is going to approach in the next couple of years ... what we spend in the national defense budget."

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2010 in an interview with the BBC NewsHour:
quote_txt: About 1 in 10 public school teachers in Wisconsin would have been laid off without federal stimulus funds.

description_txt: stated on November 2, 2010 in a book.:
quote_txt: Says Washington's reach extends to "even telling us what kind of light bulb we can use."

description_txt: stated on November 20, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: "Georgia has the second-highest rate of childhood obesity in the United States."

description_txt: stated on October 30, 2010 in a letter to the editor of the Richmond Times-Dispatch:
quote_txt: "The budget submitted by Obama will add more to the debt than the outstanding debt of the previous 43 presidents combined."

description_txt: stated on November 2, 2010 in an election-night interview :
quote_txt: "Discretionary spending went up 84 percent in the last two years"

description_txt: stated on November 2, 2010 in Rick Perry's book, "Fed Up! Our Fight to Save America from Washington":
quote_txt: Says the federal government restricts "how much salt we can put on our food."
